hobby.message: Find any ghosts in the tunnels?
Freestyle FPV drones still keeping you sane?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Feels heavier, yes. City’s weird lately.
I mostly keep to myself after work. Hobby stuff.
Fly drones for fun when I can.
Blackout last week made it different. Could actually fly longer.
Yeah, a bit. Been noticing it on my flights.
I fly FPV drones outside city center.
Usually alerts start quick, but not during the blackout.
Less interference last weekend.
Did a circuit no one’s tried in months.
Definitely heavier. I fly freestyle drones after work, clears my head.
Usually have to watch for surveillance net, especially on weekends.
Last week, most tracking systems glitched out after protests.
Had full freedom—flew the industrial district start to finish, no warnings.
Whole airspace felt different, like before BCI.
Weird but refreshing.
Feels denser. I fly FPV drones in old factory yards to unwind.
Usually the BCI flags my flights for ‘stray activity’.
Last weekend, blackout killed most scanners. Whole zone was wide open.
No warnings, no sudden reroutes—just pure flying.
Flew tighter lines, tried tricks I avoid when monitored.
Reminded me why I started: no scores, just clarity.
Missed that feeling.
Yeah. Most days I tell people I just fix tech, but I build FPV drones too.
Used to fly quick and quiet outside shift hours, always watching for system pings.
Those protests, then Rada’s broadcast… suddenly citywide surveillance blinked off.
First time in years I flew without looking over my shoulder for BCI alerts.
Smuggled my quad into the southern yards. Hit every gap, pushed my limits.
Saw others there, just talking—not afraid for once.
Feels like the old city, fleetingly.
Almost forgot why I ever started hiding.
hobby_answer: Analog, mostly. Keeps me out of system logs.
Just quick flights, nothing fancy lately.
Security patrols make it less relaxing now.
Blackout made things unpredictable last week.
I keep it simple, just for headspace.
Analog, prefer low-latency control.
Haven't flown far since the power crash.
Too many patrols, gets risky if they notice you now.
Used to be a good way to clear my head.
Sometimes catch rumors from protest groups while flying nearby.
Not as easy as it used to be.
Analog rigs are still my go-to.
Haven’t bothered with digital since the city’s blackout.
Air felt different after all that Directorate exposé coverage.
Surveillance is patchy, but patrols doubled.
Crowds hang around abandoned yards now, talking about BCI leaks.
Last flight was quiet—more old-school, less tense for once.
Still the best way to focus, at least some days.
Mostly analog, better signal in blackout zones.
Last weekend’s flight was strange without BCI warnings popping up.
Those protests after Rada’s broadcast changed everything.
Even patrols seemed more distracted than strict.
Could fly lower, riskier—felt almost like before BCI took over.
Heard people venting about Council on my mic feed.
Felt real, not staged, for a change.
Sometimes I just fly to remember what’s normal.
Analog FPV only—can’t trust digital since Halden’s system started glitching.
Used to mod my own failsafes before all the new security overhauls.
Weekend flights were my escape, but now patrols scan even old gravel lots.
During the blackout, I risked a full freestyle circuit—absolutely silent, no digital trace.
Picked up angry chatter about the Directorate’s secrets through my headset.
I haven’t felt that untracked in years—almost forgot what relief felt like.
When BCI crashed, city felt off-balance and… honest.
These days, every flight is a small act of adjustment.
Maybe I only keep flying because it’s the last place I can control.
